intro: Takhtajaniantha austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian takhtajanian, is a rare and ancient plant belonging to the family Takhtajaniaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring woody stems and leaves with a distinctive shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It is native to a very limited geographic range in the Eastern Alps, where it thrives in specific microhabitats. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a protected species in several European countries.
